metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5195 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unity before 7.2.3 and 7.3.x before 7.3.1, as used in Ubuntu, does notproperly take focus of the keyboard when switching to the lock screen,which allows physically proximate attackers to bypass the lock screen by(1) leveraging a machine that had text selected when locking or (2)resuming from a suspension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5195` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libunity-2d-private0 - 7.2.2+14.04.20140714-0ubuntu1.1
libunity-core-6.0-9 - 7.2.2+14.04.20140714-0ubuntu1.1
unity - 7.2.2+14.04.20140714-0ubuntu1.1
unity-2d - 7.2.2+14.04.20140714-0ubuntu1.1
unity-2d-common - 7.2.2+14.04.20140714-0ubuntu1.1
unity-2d-panel - 7.2.2+14.04.20140714-0ubuntu1.1
unity-2d-shell - 7.2.2+14.04.20140714-0ubuntu1.1
unity-2d-spread - 7.2.2+14.04.20140714-0ubuntu1.1
unity-autopilot - 7.2.2+14.04.20140714-0ubuntu1.1
unity-services - 7.2.2+14.04.20140714-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: unity package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.2+14.04.20140714-0ubuntu1.1').
